protocol_name: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
protocol_name_html: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
description: The intention of this protocol is to isolate high molecular weight DNA. This means you should avoid any pipetting without using a wide-bore or cut off pipette tip, vortexing, mixer shakers or anything else which generate a velocity gradient which may shear the DNA. In addition you should be very careful not to introduce nucleases by making up buffers with nuclease-free water. Avoid unnecessary heating and do not freeze, isolated DNA should be stored in the fridge, a good extraction will be stable for months. Currently tested on E. coli and human cell lines, however it is likely to work with many gram-negative bacteria and mammalian cells.
warning: When handling phenol always wear PPE, keep a solution of 50% (w/v) PEG-400 nearby to treat the burn in the case of accidental splashes.
guidelines:
This protocol was developed by Josh Quick for the Nanopore WGS Consortium.

 

Protocol Reagents:

 

TLB:

 

100 mM NaCl

10 mM Tris-Cl, pH 8.0

25 mM EDTA, pH 8.0

0.5% (w/v) SDS

20 µg/ml Qiagen RNase A (add fresh just before use)

 

EB+Triton-X100:

 

10 mM Tris-Cl pH 8.0, 0.02% Triton X-100

 

Expected Results for Human: 

 

We have been able to generate 50-100,000 reads per flowcell (1-2 Gb) although when working with HMW DNA expect some variability. A read length N50 of 100 kb is a good result. The longest read sequenced with this protocol is 1.2 Mbp by Matt Loose.

 

 

Example run metrics:

 

Total reads                   68169

Total base pairs           1731054841

Mean                           25393.58

Median                        2770

Min                              5

Max                             949165

N25                             219420

N50                             119444

N75                             53984

 

 

Screen grab showing expected distribution from MinKNOW. A large amount of the data is off the scale which only extends to 72,000 events. Reads longer than this are not counted in the yield value which means the standard scaling factor of bases = events * 1.4 will not apply.

 

Pore occupancy (strand / strand + single pore) of 0.8 should be achievable. Overall numbers in strand with RAD004 are often >200 but fall quickly, regular restarts are needed to achieve the maximum yield.

 

 

 

Pulsed-field gel, taken from http://biorxiv.org/content/biorxiv/early/2017/04/20/128835.full.pdf showing DNA extracted using this method in lanes 8 and 9. Smear extends to about 350 kb but closely matches E. coli DNA extracted using the same method demonstrating it is the extraction method not the starting size of the chromosomes driving the size.
status_info: We use this protocol in our group and it is working

components.data: Take 5x107 human cell pellet fresh or stored at -80°C in a 50 ml Falcon tube (for E. coli I used an overnight culture of E. coli growing in 50 ml LB broth spun down at 4500 x g for 10 minutes)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take 5x107 human cell pellet fresh or stored at -80°C in a 50 ml Falcon tube (for E. coli I used an overnight culture of E. coli growing in 50 ml LB broth spun down at 4500 x g for 10 minutes)

source_data.protocol_name: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name_html: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.annotation: DNA extraction protocol adapted from Molecular Cloning by Sambrook and Russell (third edition) Chapter 6 protocol 1.
source_data.thread_text: DNA extraction protocol adapted from Molecular Cloning by Sambrook and Russell (third edition) Chapter 6 protocol 1.
source_data.body: DNA extraction protocol adapted from Molecular Cloning by Sambrook and Russell (third edition) Chapter 6 protocol 1.

components.data: Resuspend by pipette mixing in 200 µl sterile PBS.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Resuspend by pipette mixing in 200 µl sterile PBS.

components.data: Add 10 ml TLB and vortex at full speed for 5 seconds.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 10 ml TLB and vortex at full speed for 5 seconds.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 3 of Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name_html: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.annotation: Vortexing here is to thoughly resuspend the cells to achieve a homogenous DNA solution once cells are lysed, DNA will not be damaged as it is still packaged inside the cell.
source_data.thread_text: Vortexing here is to thoughly resuspend the cells to achieve a homogenous DNA solution once cells are lysed, DNA will not be damaged as it is still packaged inside the cell.
source_data.body: Vortexing here is to thoughly resuspend the cells to achieve a homogenous DNA solution once cells are lysed, DNA will not be damaged as it is still packaged inside the cell.

source_data.description: Incubate at 37°C for 1 hour.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 4 of Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name_html: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.annotation: Solution will turn transparent as the cells lyse.
source_data.thread_text: Solution will turn transparent as the cells lyse.
source_data.body: Solution will turn transparent as the cells lyse.

components.data: Add 100 µl Qiagen Proteinase K or other stock solution to a final concentration of 200 µg/ml. Mix by slowly rotating end-over-end 3 times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100 µl Qiagen Proteinase K or other stock solution to a final concentration of 200 µg/ml. Mix by slowly rotating end-over-end 3 times.

components.data: Incubate at 50°C for 2 hours, mix every 30 minutes by slowly rotating end-over-end 3 times.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at 50°C for 2 hours, mix every 30 minutes by slowly rotating end-over-end 3 times.

components.data: Split the viscous lysate into the two 15 ml Falcon tubes prepared with phase-lock gel, this is easiest using a 10 ml serological pipette at slow speed.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Split the viscous lysate into the two 15 ml Falcon tubes prepared with phase-lock gel, this is easiest using a 10 ml serological pipette at slow speed.

components.data: Add 5 ml recently opened BioUltra TE-saturated phenol to each Falcon tube containing lysate.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 5 ml recently opened BioUltra TE-saturated phenol to each Falcon tube containing lysate.

components.data: Place on a HulaMixer at 20 rpm for 10 minutes, if a fine emulsion has not formed after a minute gradually increase the rotation speed.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place on a HulaMixer at 20 rpm for 10 minutes, if a fine emulsion has not formed after a minute gradually increase the rotation speed.

components.data: Spin in a centrifuge at 4500 rpm for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin in a centrifuge at 4500 rpm for 10 minutes.

components.data: Pour the aqueous phases into two new 15 ml Falcon tubes containing phase-lock gel, try to avoid transferring any protein which may form a white layer above the phase-lock gel.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Pour the aqueous phases into two new 15 ml Falcon tubes containing phase-lock gel, try to avoid transferring any protein which may form a white layer above the phase-lock gel.

components.data: Add 2.5 ml buffer saturated phenol and 2.5 ml chloroform-isoamyl alcohol 24:1 to each tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 2.5 ml buffer saturated phenol and 2.5 ml chloroform-isoamyl alcohol 24:1 to each tube.

components.data: Place on a HulaMixer at 20 rpm for 10 minutes, if a fine emulsion has not formed after a minute gradually increase the rotation speed.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place on a HulaMixer at 20 rpm for 10 minutes, if a fine emulsion has not formed after a minute gradually increase the rotation speed.

components.data: Spin in a centrifuge at 4500 rpm for 10 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin in a centrifuge at 4500 rpm for 10 minutes.

components.data: Combine the aqueous phases from the two tubes by pouring slowly into a new 50 ml Falcon tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Combine the aqueous phases from the two tubes by pouring slowly into a new 50 ml Falcon tube.
Add 4 ml 5 M ammonium acetate.

components.data: Add 30 ml ice-cold ethanol and watch the DNA precipitate, bubbles will over time pull the mass of DNA to the surface so it looks like a Jellyfish with tentacles hanging down.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 30 ml ice-cold ethanol and watch the DNA precipitate, bubbles will over time pull the mass of DNA to the surface so it looks like a Jellyfish with tentacles hanging down.

components.data: Make a hook by melting the tip of glass capillary in a blue flame so it curls over.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Make a hook by melting the tip of glass capillary in a blue flame so it curls over.

components.data: Hook out the DNA in one-piece if possible lift up and allow the excess liquid to drip off.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Hook out the DNA in one-piece if possible lift up and allow the excess liquid to drip off.

components.data: Submerge the DNA in a 50 ml Falcon tube containing 70% ethanol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Submerge the DNA in a 50 ml Falcon tube containing 70% ethanol.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 22 of Protocol for long-read sequencing on MinION
source_data.protocol_name: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name_html: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.annotation: It should have fully tightened up into a whitish opaque pellet.
source_data.thread_text: It should have fully tightened up into a whitish opaque pellet.
source_data.body: It should have fully tightened up into a whitish opaque pellet.

components.data: Carefully work the pellet off the glass rod using the rim of an Eppendorf tube, let the pellet drop into the tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Carefully work the pellet off the glass rod using the rim of an Eppendorf tube, let the pellet drop into the tube.

components.data: Go back for the rest of the DNA if it broke apart and repeat.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Go back for the rest of the DNA if it broke apart and repeat.
Add 1 ml 70% ethanol to the Eppendorf.

components.data: Spin down at 10,000 xg then remove as much of the 70% ethanol as possible.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin down at 10,000 xg then remove as much of the 70% ethanol as possible.
Wash again with 1 ml 70% ethanol.

components.data: Let the remaining ethanol evaporate by leaving at RT for 15 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Let the remaining ethanol evaporate by leaving at RT for 15 minutes.

components.data: Add 100 µl EB + Triton-X100 and incubate without mixing at 5°C for 2 days to allow the pellet to fully resuspend into a translucent viscous gel.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100 µl EB + Triton-X100 and incubate without mixing at 5°C for 2 days to allow the pellet to fully resuspend into a translucent viscous gel.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 30 of Protocol for long-read sequencing on MinION
source_data.protocol_name: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name_html: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.annotation: We have found that adding Triton-X100 to a final concentration of 0.02% dramatically improves the transposase activity. If you don't want to add it to the stock DNA you can add it when you make the library.
source_data.thread_text: We have found that adding Triton-X100 to a final concentration of 0.02% dramatically improves the transposase activity. If you don't want to add it to the stock DNA you can add it when you make the library.
source_data.body: We have found that adding Triton-X100 to a final concentration of 0.02% dramatically improves the transposase activity. If you don't want to add it to the stock DNA you can add it when you make the library.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 29 of Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name_html: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.annotation: We have found that optionally adding EDTA at a final concentration 0.1 mM of does not noticably affect the activity of the transposase.
source_data.thread_text: We have found that optionally adding EDTA at a final concentration 0.1 mM of does not noticably affect the activity of the transposase.
source_data.body: We have found that optionally adding EDTA at a final concentration 0.1 mM of does not noticably affect the activity of the transposase.

comments.name: Helen Bates
Josh Quick
comments.comment_text: 0.1 mM - Sorry will fix in next version!
comments.body: 0.1 mM - Sorry will fix in next version!

components.data: Take a P2 pipette set to 1.5 µl with a cut-off tip and aspirate very slowly then try to work the DNA in the tip away from the DNA in the tube by continuously pulling and releasing the DNA to work it gradually away. Adjust the pipette volume to determine the volume of DNA you actually removed.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Take a P2 pipette set to 1.5 µl with a cut-off tip and aspirate very slowly then try to work the DNA in the tip away from the DNA in the tube by continuously pulling and releasing the DNA to work it gradually away. Adjust the pipette volume to determine the volume of DNA you actually removed.

components.data: Quantify the DNA on the Qubit BR assay, the concentration should be >1 µg/µl, it is important to use BR as the buffer contains a detergent which appears to improve mixing.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Quantify the DNA on the Qubit BR assay, the concentration should be >1 µg/µl, it is important to use BR as the buffer contains a detergent which appears to improve mixing.

components.data: Check the absorbance spectrum of the 1:10 diluted DNA on the NanoDrop, example trace below (ratios typically a little higher than other methods)
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Check the absorbance spectrum of the 1:10 diluted DNA on the NanoDrop, example trace below (ratios typically a little higher than other methods)

components.data: If necessary add more EB+Triton-X100 to the stock DNA to adjust concentration to 1 µg/ul but do not mix.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: If necessary add more EB+Triton-X100 to the stock DNA to adjust concentration to 1 µg/ul but do not mix.
Leave overnight at 5°C before use.

components.data: As slowly as you can pipette 16 µl DNA into a 0.2 ml PCR tube using a cut-off P20 pipette tip, retain the tip.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: As slowly as you can pipette 16 µl DNA into a 0.2 ml PCR tube using a cut-off P20 pipette tip, retain the tip.

components.data: Remove 1 µl from the tube as before and quantify using Qubit BR assay.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Remove 1 µl from the tube as before and quantify using Qubit BR assay.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 40 of Protocol for long-read sequencing on MinION
source_data.protocol_name: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name_html: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.annotation: DNA may still be heterogenous in concentration and as such this is the most reliable way to quantify actually input.
source_data.thread_text: DNA may still be heterogenous in concentration and as such this is the most reliable way to quantify actually input.
source_data.body: DNA may still be heterogenous in concentration and as such this is the most reliable way to quantify actually input.

components.data: Add 1.5 µl FRA and 3.5 µl EB+Triton-X100. Using a P20 set to 18 µl and the tip from before, mix up and down as slowly as possible 8 times, retain the tip.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1.5 µl FRA and 3.5 µl EB+Triton-X100. Using a P20 set to 18 µl and the tip from before, mix up and down as slowly as possible 8 times, retain the tip.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 37 of Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name_html: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.annotation: Take care not to introduce bubbles as they are hard to remove.
source_data.thread_text: Take care not to introduce bubbles as they are hard to remove.
source_data.body: Take care not to introduce bubbles as they are hard to remove.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 37 of Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name_html: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.annotation: We have found that 1.5 µl FRA is suffient to generate an efficient library and any more can lead to over-fragmentation.
source_data.thread_text: We have found that 1.5 µl FRA is suffient to generate an efficient library and any more can lead to over-fragmentation.
source_data.body: We have found that 1.5 µl FRA is suffient to generate an efficient library and any more can lead to over-fragmentation.

components.data: Using a thermocycler incubate at 30°C for 1 minute, 80°C for 1 minute then hold at 4°C.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using a thermocycler incubate at 30°C for 1 minute, 80°C for 1 minute then hold at 4°C.

components.data: Add 1 µl RAP. Using a P20 set to 19 µl and the tip from before, mix up and down as slowly as possible 8 times, discard tip.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1 µl RAP. Using a P20 set to 19 µl and the tip from before, mix up and down as slowly as possible 8 times, discard tip.

components.data: Incubate at room temperature while you prime the flowcell.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at room temperature while you prime the flowcell.

components.data: Add 30 µl FLT to tube of FLB, vortex briefly and spin down. This is the flush mix.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 30 µl FLT to tube of FLB, vortex briefly and spin down. This is the flush mix.

components.data: Place new flowcell on MinION and run platform QC .
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Place new flowcell on MinION and run platform QC .

components.data: Using a P1000 remove a little storage buffer from the inlet port using the volume adjustment screw. Load 800 µl flush mix via the inlet port slowly using the plunger. Wait 5 minutes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using a P1000 remove a little storage buffer from the inlet port using the volume adjustment screw. Load 800 µl flush mix via the inlet port slowly using the plunger. Wait 5 minutes.

components.data: Lift the cover off the SpotON port. Load 200 µl flush mix via the inlet port slowly using the plunger, try to dispense at a speed where a bead of liquid becomes visible over the SpotON port which then gets siphoned back in.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Lift the cover off the SpotON port. Load 200 µl flush mix via the inlet port slowly using the plunger, try to dispense at a speed where a bead of liquid becomes visible over the SpotON port which then gets siphoned back in.

components.data: Add 34 µl SQT and 20 µl NFW to the library tube.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 34 µl SQT and 20 µl NFW to the library tube.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 45 of Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name_html: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.annotation: Loading beads are not used as they clump when mixed with the library.
source_data.thread_text: Loading beads are not used as they clump when mixed with the library.
source_data.body: Loading beads are not used as they clump when mixed with the library.

components.data: Using a P100 set to 75 µl with a cut-off tip mix up and down as slowly as possible 5 times. On the final mix slowly pipette the diluted library onto the SpotON port as it gets siphoned in, this can take much longer than usual due to the viscosity.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using a P100 set to 75 µl with a cut-off tip mix up and down as slowly as possible 5 times. On the final mix slowly pipette the diluted library onto the SpotON port as it gets siphoned in, this can take much longer than usual due to the viscosity.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 59 of Protocol for long-read sequencing on MinION
source_data.protocol_name: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name_html: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.annotation: If it gets blocked abandon the siphon and load by holding the pipette vertically against the SpotON port and positively pipetting the library directly in.
source_data.thread_text: If it gets blocked abandon the siphon and load by holding the pipette vertically against the SpotON port and positively pipetting the library directly in.
source_data.body: If it gets blocked abandon the siphon and load by holding the pipette vertically against the SpotON port and positively pipetting the library directly in.

components.data: Add light phase-lock gel to 2 x 15 ml Falcons. If it is only available in 2 ml tubes, transfer it by cutting the lid off 3 x 2 ml tubes and spinning it out into each 15 ml Falcon.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add light phase-lock gel to 2 x 15 ml Falcons. If it is only available in 2 ml tubes, transfer it by cutting the lid off 3 x 2 ml tubes and spinning it out into each 15 ml Falcon.

source_data.thread_title: Comment on step 7 of Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.protocol_name_html: Ultra-long read sequencing protocol for Oxford Nanopore
source_data.annotation: 15 ml Falcons are used as they are narrower decreasing the surface area of the interface/gel. Using two means they balance each other in the centrifuge and gives phenol space to move which improves the emulsion.
source_data.thread_text: 15 ml Falcons are used as they are narrower decreasing the surface area of the interface/gel. Using two means they balance each other in the centrifuge and gives phenol space to move which improves the emulsion.
source_data.body: 15 ml Falcons are used as they are narrower decreasing the surface area of the interface/gel. Using two means they balance each other in the centrifuge and gives phenol space to move which improves the emulsion.

components.data: Spin down at 10,000 xg then remove as much of the 70% ethanol as possible.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Spin down at 10,000 xg then remove as much of the 70% ethanol as possible.
See guidelines for expected results.
